subject: Optimization of Planning & Execution of Projects - Approval of project by Land Acquisition Committee (LAC) - reg.

No. 208612)} Sub: Optimization of Planning & Execution of Projects Approval of project by Land Acquisition Committee (LAC) reg: Ref. 1 NHAI Policy Guideline No. 7.1.61 dated 23.10.2019 2. NHAI Policy Guideline No. 7.1.64 dated 13.12.2019 3. NHAI Policy Guideline No. 7.1.67 dated 07.08.2020 At present, the approval of alignment and Land Acquisition Plan (LAP) , including LA cost for a Project is accorded by Land Acquisition Committee (LAC) headed by Chairman in a two stage process: 2 In order to speed-up the LAC approval process and to minimise the possibility of change in land use/sale purchase of land with the malafide intention to higher compensation, the LAC approval process has been reviewed. 3 Accordingly, henceforth, the following revised procedure shall be adopted for the approval of the Projects by LAC: 3.1_ Process flow for approval of alignment and Land Acquisition Plan (LAP), including LA cost, for a Project by LAC: DPR Consultant shall submit three alignments after taking view of all stakeholders (to avoid objections at a later stage): Further, DPR Consultant/PD should consult NHLML to plan the wayside amenities along these alignment stretches. ii. PD should check the viability of all alignments on Gati Shakti portal. Checking of proposed alignment on Gati Shakti portal is necessary to know existing/ proposed infrastructure development of other Departments/Ministries in the proposed ROW/vicinity; Ministry_has also issued SOP as regards to Project planning on PM Gati shakti portal while finalizing alignment: It is better to use PM Shakti for project planning at LAC stage. iii . Then RO/PD /Technical Division shall finalize three optimal alignments recommended by DPR Consultant, after conducting the field visit and taking consultation of all stakeholders iv Then the DPR Consultant shall submit the GIS based Land Acquisition Plan (LAP) of all three optimal alignments finalized by RO/Technical Division as per the Revenue maps of all the villages  The extra cost be paid to DPR Consultants, if required as per contract provision.
